raw_comment:
1) I notice that younger people in “first world countries” like US and France tend to have a more positive outlook on the world whereas older people in the same countries have a more negative perception. In “third world countries” like Zimbabwe and Ethiopia, both adults and young people alike have a positive outlook on the world.


2) It makes me wonder if privilege and quality of life affects your outlook on life and hopefulness for the future.


3) This relates to me and my community because as someone who grew up in America, I have a level of privilege that others unfortunately don’t. This affects my worldview and it’s important to take into account other peoples experiences and perspectives.


4) How People From Different Countries View Our Future
ace_sentences: I notice a tendency in first-world countries.
The US is a first-world country.
France is a first-world country.
Younger people in the US tend to have a positive outlook on the world.
Older people in the US tend to have a negative perception of the world.
Younger people in France tend to have a positive outlook on the world.
Older people in France tend to have a negative perception of the world.
Zimbabwe is a third-world country.
Ethiopia is a third-world country.
Adults in Zimbabwe have a positive outlook on the world.
Young people in Zimbabwe have a positive outlook on the world.
Adults in Ethiopia have a positive outlook on the world.
Young people in Ethiopia have a positive outlook on the world.
I wonder whether privilege affects a person's outlook on life.
I wonder whether quality of life affects a person's outlook on life.
I wonder whether privilege affects a person's hopefulness for the future.
I wonder whether quality of life affects a person's hopefulness for the future.
I grew up in America.
America is a country.
I have a level of privilege.
Some other people do not have this level of privilege.
This privilege affects my worldview.
It is important to take into account other people's experiences.
It is important to take into account other people's perspectives.
The headline is: How People From Different Countries View Our Future.
